body.p: Grew up as a farmer in Maine. Graduated from the United States Military Academy at West Point on July 1, 1855. Served on frontier duty at Fort Riley in Kansas, and the Kansas Border War also called “Bleeding Kansas.” From 1856 to 1861 he served in Colorado, Utah and New Mexico. In early 1861 he was promoted to Captain of the 16th Infantry and Assistant Inspector of Cavalry for the Army of the Ohio. Participated in the Battle of Shiloh on April 7, 1862, and in various operations in Kentucky from August to November, 1862. Promoted to Major on October 8, 1862, for gallantry at the battle of Perryville, and again to Lieutenant Colonel in 1864 for service in the Atlanta Campaign. Later served in many administrative duties as a Judge-Advocate, and acting Assistant Inspector General through the duration of the war.
